H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H7126.def: = action by which humans or animals move to a location relatively close to the location in focus

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H3627.def: = human-made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes

H4892.def: literally: artifact of destruction; hence: = a lethal weapon

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H8337.def: = state in which a countable entity is six in number

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H5945.def: = state of being in an elevated position

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H6437.def: = action by which humans or animals turn their body to face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H6828.def: = a mountain, identified with Jebel ʾel-Aqraʿ ◄ in northern Syria, ► known by the Canaanites as the mountain of the gods

H3627.def: = human-made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes

H4660.def: = a short wooden rod used for striking the enemy in hand-to-hand combat; it could be held with one hand and was used to strike the enemy on all parts of his body, particularly where he was unprotected by armor; possibly fitted with a heavy head made of stone or metal

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H259.def: = state in which a countable entity is one in number

H3847.def: = state in which humans wear certain clothes, often for a specific purpose

H906.def: = woven material ◄ made from the stems of the flax plant; absorbs perspiration better than many other types of cloth; ► used for production of clothes; worn by priests and supernatural beings; ≈ associated with quality, strength, and coolness

H7083.def: = small box, ◄ usually made of wood, ► for carrying several pens and sometimes a cake of dried ink; inside the case, in addition to several reed pens, there were receptacles where the ink was mixed at the time of writing; usually hanging from from the owner's belt

H4975.def: = the two sides of the body of humans and certain animals between the rib cage and the hips, ► which is the place where people normally tie a girdle, breeches, loincloth, or sackcloth; ≈ a symbol of strength

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H681.def: relational indicating a location in the direct vicinity of the point of reference

H5178.def: = a reddish-brown metal, ◄ mined from the hills, ► and used, together with {L:tin<SDBH:בְּדִיל>}, for the production of bronze

H4196.def: = construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H3742.def: = heavenly creature with wings, ► carrying the throne of God, symbol of God's majesty, and associated with his presence

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H4670.def: = strip of wood or stone at the bottom of a doorway

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H3847.def: = state in which humans wear certain clothes, often for a specific purpose

H906.def: = woven material ◄ made from the stems of the flax plant; absorbs perspiration better than many other types of cloth; ► used for production of clothes; worn by priests and supernatural beings; ≈ associated with quality, strength, and coolness

H7083.def: = small box, ◄ usually made of wood, ► for carrying several pens and sometimes a cake of dried ink; inside the case, in addition to several reed pens, there were receptacles where the ink was mixed at the time of writing; usually hanging from from the owner's belt

H4975.def: = the two sides of the body of humans and certain animals between the rib cage and the hips, ► which is the place where people normally tie a girdle, breeches, loincloth, or sackcloth; ≈ a symbol of strength

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H8427.def: = causative action by which someone makes marks on a surface with a sharp objects, such as one's nails

H8420.def: = a written sign that serves as a way to confirm the authenticity of a document or to make it possible to identify a person or object

H4696.def: = front part of the head; ≈ associated with stubbornness and lack of shame

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H584.def: = action by which humans or animals make a deep inarticulate sound ◄ caused by pain, grief, or severe suffering

H602.def: = action by which humans make a deep inarticulate sound ◄ caused by pain, grief, or severe suffering

H8441.def: = state in which an event is considered utterly wrong and detestable

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H2347.def: = state in which humans or deities are unwilling to do something that may have a negative effect on someone or something else; ◄ usually caused by an emotion of affection or compassion

H2026.def: = causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way

H4889.def: = causative action or process by which humans, deities, or animals cause (other) humans, animals, or objects to be affected by violence, destruction, death, putrefaction, pollution, blemishes, and other factors that may have a destructive or deadly impact

H2205.def: = state in which a human being is nearing the end of a long life

H970.def: = a young, fully grown, unmarried male ► associated with joy and strength

H1330.def: = young unmarried woman, who has never been married before, and has never had sex with a man

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H2945.def: = children dependent on their mothers for care{N:001}; ≈ in this sense usually occurring in a variant of the expression  טַף וְנָשִׁים "children and women", often with possessives, indicating their belonging to families headed by an adult male; ≈ associated with vulnerability and lack of strength

H5066.def: = state in which objects are close to other objects in space

H8420.def: = a written sign that serves as a way to confirm the authenticity of a document or to make it possible to identify a person or object

H2490.def: = action by which priests disqualify themselves for religious service ◄ by unlawful behavior

H4720.def: = part of an object that is considered more holy than the rest

H2691.def: = collection of dwellings, not surrounded by a wall

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H2534.def: = poisonous fluid; ◄ secreted by serpents, scorpions, etc. and introduced into body of victim by bite or sting; ► used by these animals to kill their prey and/or defend themselves against their natural enemies; ≈ often used to denote suffering and injury in a more general sense as well

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H3063.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of {L:Solomon<SDBH:שְׁלֹמֹה>}, and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land
